boardgame.name: Star Trek: Fleet Captains
boardgame.description: Star Trek: Fleet Captains, designed for two or four players, is set in the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Prime Universe_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; of STAR TREK (as seen in the various TV series and movies up to Star Trek: Nemesis) and is more adversarial in nature when compared to Star Trek: Expeditions. Each player takes the role of a faction (or race) from the universe. In the base game, the choices are Klingons and Federation. Each faction has a number of ships (on Clix dials similar to the Heroclix line of components) of varying ability and with a corresponding _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;size._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; Fleets of ships are drafted to a given size total which reflects the victory points required to win. Thus, larger fleet sizes lead to higher point (and longer games)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players then _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;shuffle build_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; a deck of command cards. Choosing four decks from a set of ten decks per faction. Each deck has a unique flavor or theme, with corresponding major characters. For instance the Klingons have a deck themed around larger ships and imperial domination and Gowron is a central character. The four decks chosen will help to set the player_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s strategy for winning._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The ships chosen have physical stats like weapons, shields, engines, and sensors. They also have mission totals for science, influence, and combat missions. These determine the kinds and numbers of each kind of mission cards the player draws to form a mission deck. Completing missions gains the player points, which will win them the game. Missions could be as simple as damage an opposing ship that is larger than your own (combat), to as complex as claiming the spaces connecting your command post to your opponents (influence). Thus a player_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s chosen ships sets the types of missions they will need to earn points and the deck they build determines the way they will complete missions._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Points can also be earned for non-mission actions such as destroying a ship or building a starbase._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game itself plays out on a randomly built board of hex cards, called sectors that start the game unexplored. As each ship progresses through the sector, the cards are turned face up, revealing what is in that part of the sector (a Class-M planet, a Class-J Nebula, empty space, etc...). There are additionally random events that can occur when exploring, which usually correspond to a single episode of a series (for instance one encounter is _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;trouble with tribbles._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; Some of these encounters also give victory points._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Overall, the game can best be thought of as playing out an entire season of Star Trek with the conflict between players representing the major story arc and the turns, missions, and random encounters representing individual episodes. Players will move their ships, explore space, complete missions, play cards to upgrade their ships (and staff them with famous and not so famous crewmembers), or boost their stats in combat. Combat, while important, is not the sole path to victory, with the mission cards being the primary factor (some of which will encourage combat). The style of game will depend heavily on individual player decisions, but no matter what, it will feel like Star Trek._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Game is unplayed and is in mint condition. Bought new and unplayed. Shrinkwrap removed and did component check. All ships fine. 2 cardboard pieces missing. So it has never been played. PayPal only please, shipping in U.S. only. Size of actual game box is large so what I ship it in is also large. I checked with post office and Priority Mail is VERY expensive so I WILL SHIP IT PARCEL POST for $12.50 to anywhere in continental United States.

Only played once, pristine condition. You *MUST* purchase the Romulan expansion from me as well as it is stored in the same box. See picture here: http://boardgamegeek.com/image/1482413/star-trek-fleet-captains-romulan-empire I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m an avid game collector in a smoke-free home and take good care of my games. Unless otherwise noted above, game is complete with little or no shelf wear or damaged components. High-resolution picture available upon request. Domestic US shipping is actual shipping cost for approx. 60oz (incl. box) to your zip code from 30082 plus $3 for box and packaging (I will finalize after you order). International shipping will be actual price plus USD$6.00 (for the box and hassle, sorry, it is much more effort on my end). Contact me if you have any questions about shipping. Must pay me via PayPal (I will cover the fees). I have many other games up for sale and in most cases I can combine shipping for some significant savings, but please check with me and provide your zip code for details.
Only played once. Everything in perfect condition with extra ship as one was badly glued so your guaranteed all good miniatures.
